tool.name: Split a imzML file into smaller files with i2nca
tool.description: Split an imzML file into different smaller flies based on a ROI annoation.
tool.command:
cp "${infile.extra_files_path}/imzml" indata.imzML && cp "${infile.extra_files_path}/ibd" indata.ibd &&
'i2nca_file_splitter' 'indata.imzML' './outdata_' '$tsv_annotation' &&
mkdir $outfile_a.files_path && mv ./outdata_A.imzML "${os.path.join($outfile_a.files_path, 'imzml')}" | true && mv ./outdata_A.ibd "${os.path.join($outfile_a.files_path, 'ibd')}" | true &&
mkdir $outfile_b.files_path && mv ./outdata_B.imzML "${os.path.join($outfile_b.files_path, 'imzml')}" | true && mv ./outdata_B.ibd "${os.path.join($outfile_b.files_path, 'ibd')}" | true &&
echo "imzML A:" > $outfile_a && ls -l "$outfile_a.files_path" >> $outfile_a &&
echo "imzML B:" > $outfile_b && ls -l "$outfile_b.files_path" >> $outfile_b

param.name: infile
param.label: MSI data
param.help: Load the .imzml file on which the QC should be performed

param.name: tsv_annotation
param.label: ROI annotation as tsv file
param.help: Load a .tsv file for ROI annoation. \n This file needs three columns with 'x', 'y' and 'annotation'. Please use the origin (0|0) to refence the pixel coordinates.

data.name: outfile_a
data.label: ROI A imzML, Conversion result of ${on_string}: imzML

data.name: outfile_b
data.label: ROI B imzML, Conversion result of ${on_string}: imzML
